alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Elk; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 1:59AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Elk, Wilson, northern Labette, Neosho, northern Montgomery and northern Chautauqua Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 159 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near St. Paul to 5 miles west of Neodesha to near Grenola. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parsons, Chanute, Neodesha, Fredonia, Erie, Howard, St. Paul, Thayer, Altoona, Moline, Longton, Elk City, Buffalo, Walnut, Grenola, Galesburg, Elk Falls, Sycamore, Benedict and Stark. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for southeastern Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Chautauqua; Elk; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson
